core:description.@value: Use this method to list all the people.
Limit in the response list
Limit in the response list
The start entry of the list
The start entry of the list

The `nextPageToken` is a web safe encoded cursor to the next entry in the database.
It can be obtained by requesting paginated resource and used in next request to get
next results page.

The `nextPageToken` is a web safe encoded cursor to the next entry in the database.
It can be obtained by requesting paginated resource and used in next request to get
next results page.
People ops ID. It is UUID v4 string
People ops ID. It is UUID v4 string

Paginated response containing a single page of the result.
By default one page of the results contains 25 items. You can extend it by setting a
`limit` query parameter in your request.
When changing parameters while using the `nextPageToken` the `nextPageToken` will be ignored
and new query will be performed. Queries with `nextPageToken` should contain the same set
of parameters as the first request.
Contains a list of objects for this method.

The next page token is a web safe encoded cursor to the next entry in the database.
Use it in the next request to obtain next page of the results.

The error response when one of the parameters is invalid and can't be parsed.
Nothing can be done at this time except correcting the request to send valid data.
Indicate that the response is errored.
The error message associated with the error.

data:value.@value: The `limit` parameter is invalid. Please, provide a number between 1 and 300.

doc:raw.@value: The `limit` parameter is invalid. Please, provide a number between 1 and 300.

core:description.@value: This API supports Basic Authentication for staging environment.
Use this method to add new person

ETag of this resource for caching purposes.
__This property will be ignored when creating an object.__
The brief description (tagline) of this person.
Person full name. The input will be rejected if this property is not set while creating new object.
The URL of this person's profile.
A unique identifier for a person. It is a 32 bit string containing alphanumeric characters.
The user's preferred language for rendering.
The person's date of birth, represented as YYYY-MM-DD.

The person's gender. Possible values includes, but are not limited to, the following values:
* "male" - Male gender.
* "female" - Female gender.
* "other" - Other.

An object representing a person in the API.
This object will be used in all methods returning a Person or list of people.

data:value.@value: This response type is deprecated and soon will be replaced.

doc:raw.@value:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<xs:schema xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" elementFormDefault="qualified" attributeFormDefault="unqualified">
  <xs:element name="resource">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="id" type="xs:string"></xs:element>
        <xs:element name="name" type="xs:string"></xs:element>
        <xs:element name="birthday" type="xs:date"></xs:element>
        <xs:element name="gender" type="xs:string"></xs:element>
        <xs:element name="url" type="xs:string"></xs:element>
        <xs:element name="image">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="url" type="xs:string"></xs:element>
              <xs:element name="thumb" type="xs:string"></xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="tagline" type="xs:string"></xs:element>
        <xs:element name="language" type="xs:string"></xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
      <xs:attribute name="error" type="xs:boolean" use="required"></xs:attribute>
      <xs:attribute name="type" type="xs:string" use="required"></xs:attribute>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

data:value.@value: This method is not deprecated. And this is only an annotation test.

core:description.@value:
A custom security scheme for authenticating requests.
It allows to set `SpecialToken` header from the authorization panel.
The same header should be rendered in the headers editor with console using
RAML JS parser.
With `AMF` console this is separated information.
This scheme also sets `debugToken` and `booleanToken` query parameters.
Both are enums, however `booleanToken` can only have `true` and `false`
values.
Used to send a custom token.
Used to send a custom token.
Select one of available values to run the request in the debug mode with selected level.
Select one of available values to run the request in the debug mode with selected level.
Just to test boolean values.

Bad token.

The ID of the person in the system. It is generated by the database numeric value for the person.
The API is to be used to access data about the products.

Creates a product in the store.
While creating a product the `id` and `etag` properties will be ignored.

The endpoint will reject the request if exactly the same product is already defined in the
datastore (all properties of both objects equals). Newly created product is available
for listing but **it won't be available for ordering API** until it's availability is not set.

  lastname: ark
  kind: AcmeManager

    -
      firstname: nico
      lastname: ark
      kind: admin

This header is not set if the resource can be changed by non-admin users.
This header is not set if the resource can be changed by non-admin users.

The 401 response will be returned when trying to update the resource with
non-admin clerance level. Resources that requires admin privileges are marked with
`X-Admin-Resource` header when getting the resource.
This API supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating all API requests.
Used to send a valid OAuth 2 access token. Do not use with the "access_token" query string parameter.

Used to send a valid OAuth 2 access token. Do not use with the "Authorization" header.
Used to send a valid OAuth 2 access token. Do not use with the "Authorization" header.
Bad or expired token. This can happen if the user or Dropbox revoked or expired an access token. To fix, re-authenticate the user.
Bad OAuth request (wrong consumer key, bad nonce, expired timestamp...). Unfortunately, re-authenticating the user won't help here.

List user messages. It returns an array of messages for last of 7 days if
`since` property is not set.
You can use `since` and `until` query parameters to control messages time
span.

Date left limit of the messages query.
Date left limit of the messages query.

The URL of the image.
To resize the image and crop it to a square, append the query string **?sz=x**, where x is the dimension in pixels of each side.
An URL to the thumbnail of the image. Thumbnails are 60x60px cropped images of the original image.

An image object representing an image object strored in the file store.
The image can be only included in the response. It has no effect if the Image appear in the
request. Endpoint handles image creation on it's own and clients can't process images
except of sending image data.

doc:raw.@value:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<resource error="false" type="Product">
  <id>f2f7933a-a9ce-11e6-80f5-76304dec7eb7</id>
  <name>Acme product - mentol flavor, 500 ml.</name>
  <quantity>500</quantity>
  <unit>ml</unit>
  <upc>042100005264</upc>
  <available>true</available>
</resource>

The Universal Produc Code. It consists of 12 numerical digits. However, because of the
integer precision limitation in JavaScript it is represented as a string.

Product name

It will be available when the product is stored in the datastore.

A custom security scheme for authenticating requests.
It allows to set `SpecialToken` header from the authorization panel.
The same header should be rendered in the headers editor with console using
RAML JS parser.
With `AMF` console this is separated information.
This scheme also sets `debugToken` and `booleanToken` query parameters.
Both are enums, however `booleanToken` can only have `true` and `false`
values.

doc:raw.@value:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<xs:schema xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" elementFormDefault="qualified" attributeFormDefault="unqualified">
  <xs:element name="resource">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="message" type="xs:string"></xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
      <xs:attribute name="error" type="xs:boolean" use="required"/>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

core:description.@value:
ETag of this resource for caching purposes.
__This property will be ignored when creating an object.__
The brief description (tagline) of this person.
Person full name. The input will be rejected if this property is not set while creating new object.
The URL of this person's profile.
The user's preferred language for rendering.
A unique identifier for a person. It is a 32 bit string containing alphanumeric characters.
The person's date of birth, represented as YYYY-MM-DD.

The URL of the image.
To resize the image and crop it to a square, append the query string **?sz=x**, where x is the dimension in pixels of each side.
An URL to the thumbnail of the image. Thumbnails are 60x60px cropped images of the original image.

An image object representing an image object strored in the file store.
The image can be only included in the response. It has no effect if the Image appear in the
request. Endpoint handles image creation on it's own and clients can't process images
except of sending image data.

The person's gender. Possible values includes, but are not limited to, the following values:
* "male" - Male gender.
* "female" - Female gender.
* "other" - Other.

An object representing a person in the API.
This object will be used in all methods returning a Person or list of people.

doc:raw.@value:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<resource error="false" type="AppPerson">
  <id>Qawer63J73HJ6khjswuqyq62382jG21s</id>
  <name>John Smith</name>
  <birthday>1990-10-12</birthday>
  <gender>male</gender>
  <url>https://www.domain.com/people/Qawer63J73HJ6khjswuqyq62382jG21s</url>
  <image>
    <url>https://www.domain.com/people/Qawer63J73HJ6khjswuqyq62382jG21s/image</url>
    <thumb>https://www.domain.com/people/Qawer63J73HJ6khjswuqyq62382jG21s/image/thumb</thumb>
  </image>
  <tagline>Hi, I'm John!</tagline>
  <language>en_US</language>
</resource>

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<xs:schema xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" elementFormDefault="qualified" attributeFormDefault="unqualified">
  <xs:element name="resource">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="id" type="xs:string"></xs:element>
        <xs:element name="name" type="xs:string"></xs:element>
        <xs:element name="birthday" type="xs:date"></xs:element>
        <xs:element name="gender" type="xs:string"></xs:element>
        <xs:element name="url" type="xs:string"></xs:element>
        <xs:element name="image">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="url" type="xs:string"></xs:element>
              <xs:element name="thumb" type="xs:string"></xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="tagline" type="xs:string"></xs:element>
        <xs:element name="language" type="xs:string"></xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
      <xs:attribute name="error" type="xs:boolean" use="required"></xs:attribute>
      <xs:attribute name="type" type="xs:string" use="required"></xs:attribute>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

data:value.@value: The start entry of the list

The `nextPageToken` is a web safe encoded cursor to the next entry in the database.
It can be obtained by requesting paginated resource and used in next request to get
next results page.

Paginated response containing a single page of the result.
By default one page of the results contains 25 items. You can extend it by setting a
`limit` query parameter in your request.
When changing parameters while using the `nextPageToken` the `nextPageToken` will be ignored
and new query will be performed. Queries with `nextPageToken` should contain the same set
of parameters as the first request.
Contains a list of objects for this method.

The next page token is a web safe encoded cursor to the next entry in the database.
Use it in the next request to obtain next page of the results.

The error response when one of the parameters is invalid and can't be parsed.
Nothing can be done at this time except correcting the request to send valid data.
Indicate that the response is errored.
The error message associated with the error.
The `limit` parameter is invalid. Please, provide a number between 1 and 300.

doc:usage.@value:
This trait is to be used when the resource is paginated that is the edpoint producses
a list of resources in the response.
Every paginated response contains a `nextPageToken` property that should be used in pagination
to request for next page of the results and `items` which is a list of resources.
The `items` property is always defined, even if the response is empty. Therefore the `404`
response in this case is not possible. Clients need to handle empty responses by their own.
It is crutial that the subsequent requests contain the same set of parameters (like `limit`
or `start`) because if this values will change then the `nextPageToken` will be revalidated
and pagination will start from the first page.

data:value.@value: Use this to mark a resource that can be changed only by users with admin level.
This header is not set if the resource can be changed by non-admin users.

The 401 response will be returned when trying to update the resource with
non-admin clerance level. Resources that requires admin privileges are marked with
`X-Admin-Resource` header when getting the resource.

doc:usage.@value:
Some resources can be changed only by users with Admin clerance level. This resources will be
marked with the header `X-Admin-Resource` when requesting it. It means that every attemp to
update the resource by non-admin user will result with 401 response.

ETag of this resource for caching purposes.

Common properties for all resources returned by the API.

The Universal Produc Code. It consists of 12 numerical digits. However, because of the
integer precision limitation in JavaScript it is represented as a string.

ETag of this resource for caching purposes.
__This property will be ignored when creating an object.__
Product name

Product id. It is a UUID of the database record.
__This property will be ignored when creating an object.__
It will be available when the product is stored in the datastore.
The unit of measuremet for the quantity property.

Product current availability in the store.
Product may be not available but the users still can order it with later delivery date.

The quantity of the product in the one unit of measurement.
See `unit` property for more information.
A single product representing an item in the store.
